item.title: Report E-2025020088
item.description:
Report E-2025020088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-06
  • City: DANVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 6, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the sites and containerized all impacted materials in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum of product was overpacked in one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2025010017
item.description:
Report I-2025010017

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While seated, the passenger in 20A went to the back and told the FAs that her phone smelled. The flight attendants then went to 20A, where they could smell something burning. No flames or smoke were seen. No passengers around or flight attendants reported irritation or feeling sick. The flight attendants reported that the charging brick and charging cable were warm and smelled like something was burning. The phone was turned off, and the charger was unplugged from the outlet immediately. Once it was unplugged, the smell went away. The flight attendants also said the passenger's phone would not charge and that the charging cable was damaged but had no exposed wires. Item placed in TCB for remainder of flight.

item.title: Report X-2025011319
item.description:
Report X-2025011319

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A SINGLE 4.3 OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE KRISTIN ESS DRY SHAMPOO THAT WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM INDIANA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER Y190A6, CVS STORE 07970, 4511 W ALGONQUIN RD, LAKE IN THE HILLS IL 60156-3502.

item.title: Report X-2025011301
item.description:
Report X-2025011301

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: SAUK VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An 800 lb. pallet of freight was loaded on top of a pallet containing 5 boxes of gallons of Acetone. One of the boxes was crushed causing 3 of the 1 gallon bottles to leak roughly 2 gallons onto the trailer floor. By the time the trailer was opened and the spill was discovered, the spill had dried. CURA was contacted and advised there would be nothing to clean and the crew would just place the bottles into a recovery drum so no crew was sent out.

item.title: Report X-2025011288
item.description:
Report X-2025011288

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING HAZMAT IN OB 6. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER NOTICE. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON SIX SIDES OF PACKAGE, LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFIED AND THE MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS PLACED IN THE UNCONFRIMED DMP STORAGE AREA, UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.
